intro: Hemitelia subincisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hemitelia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, pink to purple flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Hemitelia subincisa thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
